benchmark_details.name: Complex-TR (Complex Temporal Reasoning)
benchmark_details.overview: The Complex-TR dataset focuses on multi-answer and multi-hop temporal reasoning, addressing the shortcomings of existing temporal QA datasets that primarily evaluated one-hop questions and used inappropriate metrics for multi-answer assessments.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive evaluation framework for multi-hop and multi-answer temporal reasoning in question-answering systems.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset may contain factual errors existing in the Wikidata knowledge base.

data.source: Constructed from the Wikidata knowledge base and verified using human annotators.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the strict criteria of matching the entire set of answers.
methodology.interpretation: Higher set accuracy indicates better performance on multi-answer questions; lower answer F1 scores indicate the model's struggle to retrieve all correct answers.
methodology.validation: Human verification of the QA pairs and contexts.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: The data was constructed from the Wikidata knowledge base and Wikipedia articles, which are under creative commons licenses.
